net.rem.soco

Class Soco

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.alg.AlgAbstract
      • net.hudup.core.alg.ExecutableAlgAbstract
        • net.rem.em.EMAbstract
          • net.rem.em.ExponentialEM
            • net.rem.soco.Soco
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, java.util.EventListener, net.hudup.core.alg.Alg, net.hudup.core.alg.AlgRemote, net.hudup.core.alg.AlgRemoteTask, net.hudup.core.alg.ExecutableAlg, net.hudup.core.alg.ExecutableAlgRemote, net.hudup.core.alg.ExecutableAlgRemoteTask, net.hudup.core.alg.MemoryBasedAlg, net.hudup.core.alg.MemoryBasedAlgRemote, net.hudup.core.alg.MemoryBasedAlgRemoteTask, net.hudup.core.alg.SetupAlgListener, net.hudup.core.data.Exportable, net.hudup.core.logistic.Inspectable, EM, EMRemote, EMRemoteTask

    @BaseClass
public class Soco
extends ExponentialEM
    This class implements soft cosine similarity with missing values (Soco measure), based on expectation-maximization (EM) algorithm.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • terminatedCondition

        protected boolean terminatedCondition(java.lang.Object estimatedParameter,
                                      java.lang.Object currentParameter,
                                      java.lang.Object previousParameter,
                                      java.lang.Object... info)
        Description copied from class: EMAbstract
        Setting the terminated condition for EM. The usual terminated condition is that the bias between current parameter and estimated parameter is smaller than a positive predefined epsilon. However the terminated condition is dependent on particular application.
        Specified by:
        terminatedCondition in class EMAbstract
        Parameters:
        estimatedParameter - estimated parameter.
        currentParameter - current parameter.
        previousParameter - previous parameter.
        info - additional information.
        Returns:
        true if the EM algorithm can stop.
